review_blob:
APPEARANCE/ SMELL: reddish brown with no head. Sweet caramel smell with piny hops.
MOUTHFEEL: thick, syrupy, and sticky
TASTE: initially malty and sweet, then caramel. Then bitter then alcoholic. The alcohol wasnt too pronounced but warmed on the way down.
THOUGHTS: this more closely resembles a barley wine than IPA. DD was lacking in the citrus, lemony hop flavors and smells. The only thing hoppy about it was the bitter aftertaste, which wasnt even that bitter or lasting. GREAT BARLEYWINE, POOR IPA

Best belgian Ive had so far. Strong fruity flavour and alcohol hidden well. Impressive foamy head and wonderful fruity smell. A good intro beer of its type.....I typically dont like belgians, even those that everyone here are so fond of. But this was very tasty.

2006 ceramic bottle. Courtesy of Four Seasons, Hadley, MA.

Warm, chocolate, roasted coffee aroma. Creamy brown head that wont go away. Mouth-feel is thick, creamy, sticky, and syrupy. Dont get this stuff on your hands, its like maple syrup. ____ Taste is of chocolate followed by intense coffee. Alcohol is well hidden. Best attributes: chocolate aroma and thick mouth-feel.
Over all, the epitome of an imperial stout, but not the pinnacle.

Bomber, courtesy of Russells in Amherst, MA.
:::APPEARANCE::: dark reddish brown, just like maple syrup, head was very minimal but was a nice thick creamy texture::: AROMA::: I could smell it from 3 ft. away, cherries, sweet and malty, berries, grapes, and citrus hops:::TASTE:::bread-like malt and bitterness up front, then sweet malts followed by a slowly developing hop bitterness that lasts for awhile, despite the citrus hops in the aroma, there were none in the taste:::MOUTH-FEEL:::medium/thin body, syrupy, modest carbonation_____Honestly, I expected better. The aroma was the best thing about DB. I like bitterness, but something throws me off in this one. I think maybe the bitterness persists too long, after the first taste it just wouldnt leave and ruined other flavors. Forget Ruination, this one is far more ruinous to your palate........IMHO, Double Bastard is best enjoyed in spaced-apart sips.

33 oz growler, courtesy of Amherst Brewery..........Look: like apple cider, thick and cloudy but not opaque, minimal tan head.....

Smell: vaporized weed, grassy hops, biscuits, cider.....

Taste: hops, malts, grass, caramel, grapefruit. bitter aftertaste that lasts a few seconds..... 

This ones pretty good but is lacking in a few areas. First off, for an Imperial IPA, the flavor should have been some what stronger. While pleasant, it just didnt hold up as long as say, the 90minute. Second, it just wasnt bitter enough. And third, it was rather watery. All in all though, this one is good and something Id get again.
UPDATED: JUN 7, 2008

22oz bottle courtesy of Russells in Amherst, MA.
Following Stones advice I prepared a pb&j; and cracked my bomber open. I ended up enjoying the sandwich more...

Im a big fan of Stone but this was just awful. SSP had a rusted metal, olive scent. Taste was of smoked rotten olives and beef. There wasnt an ounce of chocolate, vanilla or anything enjoyable in there. Mouth feel was okay but rather thin. When I started on the sandwich it  brought out the alcohol flavor and made things worse. 
Maybe this bottle was bad? Maybe I havent developed a taste for smoked brews? Either way, this is one of the few bombers Ive had to give away, and even then, it went unfinished.

22oz dust-covered  bottle, courtesy of 4 Seasons in Hadley, MA

Smell: Very nutty, nice hazelnut aroma with a little bit of caramel and chocolate.

Taste: Not sweet, not bitter.  What I got was a very mellow, creamy, nutty flavor, not strong at all. It reminds me of a hazelnut coffee with way too much cream so that a lot of the intense flavor is gone. Minuscule hop presence. Aftertaste is nutty then roasted coffee.
Flavor is good but if it packed the appeal of the smell it would be great.

Other: Carbonation was a lot higher in this one. It messed with my taste buds. Viscosity was rather thin but left a creamy coating in your mouth.

Unique and complicated flavor thats hard to describe exactly. Theres definitely hops in there, along with caramel, alcohol, citrus, and maybe licorice. Mouth feel was thick and chewy. The after taste was somewhat alcoholic and I didnt really like that. I found it difficult to finish this with my pork chop meal. The alcohol was really pronounced and gross for some reason. However, 90 minute is still very good and something Ill pick up, albeit occasionally.

22 oz bottle..
Nice Imperial IPA. Had it in between Ruination so I compared it to that. This was pretty thick and domineering for an IPA but not over powering. The flavor was strong and malty and bitter but not as much as some other IPAs. Detected hints of chocolate, roasted malts, light citrus, and of course  piny hops. Recommended over DFH 90 minute but not Stone Ruination.
On tap in Amherst Ma. A nice but typical IPA.    Nice bitter after taste and pleasant initial floral hop flavor. Nice white frothy head. What stood out most to me was the amazing lacing on the glass.
beer_name: Berkshire Lost Sailor India Pale Ale

review_blob: UPDATED: NOV 17, 2007

I expected more. First off this is not an Imperial Stout. Its rather weak compared to others. The flavor was weak and nothing special, the thick texture is what saved it for me. The aroma wasnt too great either. It reminded me of dirty pennies...gross.
On tap over at ABC. Has a nice sweet caramel flavor and scent. Unfortunately the aftertaste is very short lived. Probably the best brew over at Amherst Brewery.
On tap from the brewery. Had your typical hoppy smell and typical hoppy flavor but with orange and lime somewhere in there. A good IPA.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2008
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Oak Aged

review_blob: UPDATED: NOV 17, 2007

Strong bitter flavor. Best described as hoppy, fruity, rich, thick, and warm. I liked this one much more than S.N.s other brews but felt the alcohol flavor could have been balanced better. Then again, it is a barley wine... The bottle was really cool and I would probably buy this again.

After all the hype I was disappointed. There just wasnt much chocolate there and as for the thick and creamy texture I expected, That was absent. What I tasted was better than average beer with the faintest touch of chocolate. Im not sure if I just got a crappy bottle, but I would rather have paid double the price and bought a Yeti instead.
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2007
beer_name: Stone Sublimely Self Righteous Black IPA
